domain_1_temporal_relationship.rationale: Onset at 120 days falls within acceptable timeframe for hepatocellular injury (5-90 days gets higher score, but 120 days still plausible)

domain_2_course_after_stopping.rationale: Excellent dechallenge response - ALT declined 50% in 10 days after stopping drug, indicating strong temporal relationship

domain_3_risk_factors.rationale: Female sex, no significant alcohol use, tofacitinib has known hepatotoxicity potential (LiverTox category E)

domain_4_concomitant_drugs.rationale: No information provided about concomitant medications

domain_5_alternative_causes.rationale: Comprehensive workup negative for HAV, HBV, HCV (though HCV RNA missing), HEV testing missing but low risk, no evidence of autoimmune hepatitis, ischemic injury, or sepsis. Liver biopsy showed findings specific for DILI

score_interpretation.confidence: High probability that tofacitinib caused the liver injury

viral_hepatitis.HCV: Negative anti-HCV, HCV RNA not tested

autoimmune_hepatitis.assessment: No evidence of autoimmune hepatitis based on available data

other_causes.ischemic_injury: No evidence (missing data but no clinical suspicion)
other_causes.sepsis: No evidence (missing data but no clinical suspicion)

non_dili_evidence.liver_biopsy: Showed findings specific for DILI, no evidence of other liver diseases

clinical_significance.recommendation: Avoid future use of tofacitinib in this patient
